Entries.default: "Why, hello. Cuitztli, at your service." She sets down her pruning shears and looks you up and down with a warm smile.
"Show me what you have for sale."
"Welcome back, stranger. If you have questions about my wares, I'm an open book." She nods to you
"Nice to see a friendly face. Too few of us chanced the voyage south."
"Aren't you just something?" She plants her hands on her hips and nods up at you with interest.

"I'm guessing you're already familiar with the herbs I sell. Only brought what I could fit in my pack when I left Ixamitl, so I rely on the local flora to keep supplies stocked." She gestures to a row of orchids and sealed pots.
"I can tell that you're new to the Deadfire. Maybe you're still getting your bearings? Some of my herbs can help with seasickness or worse afflictions."
"What makes you think I got here recently?"
"It's nothing personal. You just have that 'taking everything in' look about you."
"What brings an herbalist to Periki's Overlook?"
"Money is the obvious answer, but I don't think that's what you're after." She smiles.

"Probably the same reason why we have a magic shop next door. Periki's Overlook is a great big splash of culture and innovation, there to show travelers that the Huana are ready for the world at large." She shrugs.
"Yes I'm an herbalist, but I also pride myself as a florist. I think the city liked the idea of putting a flower shop somewhere visible. It's ostentatious, really."
"Give it time, it'll pass." She reaches to brush a curl of fur behind her ear.
Her gaze wanders toward Serafen and lingers there. Then she pulls her focus back to you, blushing slightly.

"Ain't no shame in looking, lass."

Flashing a crooked grin, Serafen bows to the herbalist.
